newsitem.title: ISRAEL: Israel share funds suffer 1.7 pct decline in March.
newsitem.headline: Israel share funds suffer 1.7 pct decline in March.

text.p: Israeli share funds averaged a 1.7 percent negative return in March against a 3.4 percent rise in February, Meitav Investments and Securities said on Tuesday.

Meitav's index of all mutual funds, including funds that invested in other financial instruments such as bonds and foreign currency, was unchanged in March as other types of funds posted slight gains.

Meitav said in a report that March was a month of profit taking in the stock market after sharp rises in January and February. "Profit taking was influenced by a halt in negotiations with the Palestinians and a deteriorating security situation -- including the first bombing in Tel Aviv in a year. Foreign investors sat on the fence," the report said.
The Bank of Israel's failure to lower interest rates also affected the stock and bond markets.
In the first quarter the index of all mutual funds gained 9.2 percent led by stock funds, which rose 17.1 percent.
